dict.string: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string
The version of the whole configuration profile.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user.
Prevent user from signing in to any O365 service.

This will prevent user from signing in to any O365 service. This has the added effect of making sure users store no data online via microsoft servers.
* As of 16.13.0 these options work again. 0 - all accounts allowed 1 - prevent institutional accounts - only MSA (personal) accounts 2 - prevent MSA (personal) accounts - only institution accounts 4 - no accounts allowed to sign in
This key when set to false will deactivate the ability for users to use the "Smile" feature.
Suppress the Office 365 AutoDiscover redirect warning.
Suppress the Office 365 AutoDiscover redirect warning.
Set to false to send minimal heartbeat data, no application usage, and no environment details.
Set to false to send minimal heartbeat data, no application usage, and no environment details.
Disable the "Connected Services" screen when updating from pre-16.13. (MSA-based accounts).

MSA-based Key to suppress a screen on update from pre-16.13 called "Connected Services" with an Accept button on it. If you wish to suppress this new dialog for MSA-based accounts set this key to TRUE.
Disable the "Connected Services" screen when updating from pre-16.13. (OrgID accounts).
OrgID-based Key to suppress a screen on update from pre-16.13 called "Connected Services" with an OK button on it. If you wish to suppress this new dialog for OrgID users set this key to TRUE.
Disable the "What's New" dialog and Office 365 activation prompt on first launch.
Controls the original "What's New" dialog and Office 365 activation prompt on first launch.
Disable the offer to import mailbox or setup an email account.
Controls offer to import mailbox or setup an email account. (That's a cap o15, not zero15).
This hides local "On My Computer" folders in Outlook.
Array of sequential ints to disable the "What's New" dialog on first lauch after upgrades.
Controls the dynamic "What's New" dialog on first lauch after upgrades. An array of sequential ints. This may change due to MS Bug VSO #1476177.
Download of pictures in the reading panel.

Controls the download of pictures in the reading panel. GUI Preference > Email > Reading > Security. Automatically is spelt incorrectly in the key this is a typo in the source code! 0 = Never, 1 = In messages from my contacts, 2 = In all messages
Disable Modern Authentication connections from Outlook.
Allows an admin to disable Modern Authentication connections from Outlook.
Disable promotion dialog in the links column.

Outlook code checks this key on launch after a O365 activation.
If set to FALSE, it pops the advertising dialog in the links column -> If the key is set to TRUE, the code believes that the user has already seen the dialog.
Disable promotion dialog about adding Google Contacts/Calendar.

Outlook code checks this key on launch after a O365 activation.
If set to FALSE, it pops the promotion dialog about adding Google Contacts/Calendar. If the key is set to TRUE, the code believes that the user has already seen the dialog.
Disable account configuration window when the profile is empty.
With the true value of the settings, Outlook will stop prompting for account add when the profile is empty during first run and subsequent start.
Disable import of PSTs, Identities and OLMs.
Prevents the user from being able to import PSTs, Identities and OLMs.
Preents the user from being able to export mail from Outlook.

Full email address or just the domain. Formatting for the domain would be [second-level domain].[top level-domain] — this will take the alias/username from the activation email address and place with the domain entered in this pref key. For configuring O365 mailboxes.

It’s a string that takes either a full email address or just the domain. Formatting for the domain would be [second-level domain].[top level-domain] — this will take the alias/username from the activation email address and place with the domain entered in this pref key. For configuring O365 mailboxes.
Disable the "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog when updating from pre-16.17.

Users who are activated with O365 will see a new "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog in Word, Excel & PowerPoint after updating to 16.17. The net effect of doing this will enable Researcher (Word), Translate (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Smart Lookup (Word, PowerPoint), and QuickStarter (PowerPoint). Set to TRUE to auto-accept. Requires "kFREIntelligenceServicesConsentV2Key" as well.
Disable the "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog when updating from pre-16.17.

Users who are activated with O365 will see a new "Use Intelligent Services?" pop-up dialog in Word, Excel & PowerPoint after updating to 16.17. The net effect of doing this will enable Researcher (Word), Translate (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Smart Lookup (Word, PowerPoint), and QuickStarter (PowerPoint). Set to TRUE to auto-accept. Requires "PII_And_Intelligent_Services_Preference" as well.
Sends crash reports even if telemetry is disabled.

This will stop your client devices sending us usage telemetry and asking questions to your users, but if the app crashes, we'll still invoke our Error Reporting dialog and get the call-stack back here so we can see if you're running into problems. The issue here is that if you don't enable crash reporting, we are completely blind as to whether folks out there are having problems or not. Relevant for those who disable telemetry through the SendAllTelemetryEnabled key.

Specify one or more domains users are allowed to add in Outlook. Format strings as regular expressions. Does not remove or disconnect accounts already added in Outlook. Supports regular expressions to allow for catching multiple domains.

Specify one or more domains users are allowed to add in Outlook. Format strings as regular expressions. Does not remove or disconnect accounts already added in Outlook. Supports regular expressions to allow for catching multiple domains.
Hide the “Did you know? Outlook supports…” text in the Set Up Your Email success dialog box. Only hides text. Does not impact ability to add non-corporate mailboxes.
Hide the “Did you know? Outlook supports…” text in the Set Up Your Email success dialog box. Only hides text. Does not impact ability to add non-corporate mailboxes.
Prevent users from adding Skype for Business online meeting details to events. Key must be set to true and forced.
Prevent users from adding Skype for Business online meeting details to events. Key must be set to true and forced.
Set default location for weather in calendar view. Use the format returned by the weather location search within Outlook. Example: "Paris, France"
Set default location for weather in calendar view. Use the format returned by the weather location search within Outlook. Example: "Paris, France"
Prevent users from choosing Update Location Automatically for weather location.
Prevent users from choosing Update Location Automatically for weather location.
Prevent users from being able to create, edit, and add client-side signatures. Key must be set to true and forced.
Prevent users from being able to create, edit, and add client-side signatures. Key must be set to true and forced.
Set the first day of week in calendar view.
Set the first day of week in calendar view. 1 = Sunday (default) 2 = Monday 3 = Tuesday 4 = Wednesday 5 = Thursday 6 = Friday 7 = Saturday
Disable the Teams button in Outlook.
